text: Bailey Scott (born 9 July 2000) is a professional Australian rules footballer playing for the North Melbourne Football Club in the Australian Football League (AFL). ==Early life== Scott was born in Melbourne.AFL draft 2018: Sneaky signs that suggested Bailey Scott was destined for North Melbourne His father, Robert, was a professional footballer who played for Geelong and North Melbourne between 1986-2000. Robert played 245 games at the highest level and was a premiership player for the Kangaroos in 1996. At the age of nine, Bailey moved to Gold Coast, Queensland with his family and began playing junior football for the Broadbeach Cats. A talented junior footballer, Scott joined the Gold Coast Suns' Academy at the age of 12Young gun's triple draft dilemma while attending St Andrews Lutheran College.Queensland Blaze team announced In his final year of junior football, Scott was selected to captain the Gold Coast in the Academy Series and the Allies in the 2018 AFL Under 18 Championships. He was subsequently named in the All-Australian team for his performances in the national championships.Scott to become 179th Queenslander to play AFL In October 2018, he elected to be drafted by North Melbourne as a father-son selection, despite also having the option to join Geelong or Gold Coast.Bailey Scott picks North The Kangaroos drafted Scott with pick 49 in the 2018 AFL draft.Healy: Scott a “steal" ==AFL career== Scott debuted for North Melbourne in round 1 of the 2019 AFL season.Bailey Scott to make AFL debut for Kangaroos against Fremantle He won the Round 1 AFL Rising Star nomination in his debut, with 21 disposals and two goals. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:North Melbourne Football Club players Category:Australian rules footballers from Queensland Category:Sportspeople from the Gold Coast, Queensland
